intro: Xeranthemum tenuifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved erigeron, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, linear leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer, and it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowers. Xeranthemum tenuifolium is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
